title: What type of support for victims and who is providing it?
content:
Access to medical and rehabilitative assistance to mine survivors, and other persons with disabilities in Myanmar has increased significantly in 2014 and 2015, but still remains inadequate. 

There are many actors who are contributing to Victim Assistance efforts including UNICEF, Myanmar Red Cross, ICRC, Handicap International and many more national and international organizations and of course the Governments. The Department of Social Welfare is the focal agency for disability and it has increased its attention including the support to victims of landmines and ERW.
 
The services includes wide ranges: For examples, emergency medical services, physical rehabilitation, psychosocial counselling, livelihood and etc.
But we need clear mapping of who is providing what and where?  The communities need to know where to go and who to call if there is such incidents. I think this is one of the key agenda of the MR working group planned for 2015-2016.
